text: Lisa Halliday (born July 12, 1976) is an American author. She mainly writes novels. Halliday has written several books. Her most popular book is Asymmetry. She won the Whiting Award for it in 2017.' == Reviews == Of Halliday's book Asymmetry, Alice Gregory of the New York Times Book Review wrote, "Hallidayâ€™s novel is so strange and startlingly smart that its mere existence seems like commentary on the state of fiction". There were also positive reviews from Karen Heller of the Washington Post and Parul Sehgal of the New York Times. == Works == * == References == Category:1976 births Category:Living people Category:Writers from Massachusetts Category:Harvard University alumni
title: Lisa Halliday
